text: Liberia at the Olympics is a history which began in 1956. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for Liberia is LBR. "Official abbreviations" at The Games of the XVIII Olympiad, Tokyo, 1964, [p. 9 of 409 PDF]; retrieved 2012-10-12. ==History== Teams from Liberia has been to every Summer Olympic Games held since 1956, except for 1968, 1976 and 1992. The country has never won an Olympic medal. No athletes from Liberia have been in any Winter Olympic Games. The National Olympic Committee for Liberia was formed in 1954. It was recognized by the International Olympic Committee in 1955. ==Summary== Games Athletes Athletes by sport Medals Medals Medals Games Athletes Melbourne 1956 1 4 0 0 0 Rome 1960 1 4 0 0 0 Tokyo 1964 1 4 0 0 0 Mexico City 1968 did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete Munich 1972 1 4 0 0 0 Montreal 1976 did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete Moscow 1980 1 7 0 0 0 Los Angeles 1984 1 4 0 0 0 Seoul 1988 1 5 0 0 0 Barcelona 1992 did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete did not compete Atlanta 1996 1 5 0 0 0 Sydney 2000 1 7 0 0 0 Athens 2004 1 2 0 0 0 Beijing 2008 1 3 0 0 0 ==Related pages== * List of IOC country codes ==References== Category:Sport in Liberia Category:Nations at the Olympics
